data.title: Utah Valley University
meta_keywords: stamps; first class mail; priority mail; shipping; international shipping; military mail;
data.meta_description: UVU has it's very own USPS Contract Postal Unit! We're located in the Sorensen Student Center across the hall from Campus Connection. We are NOT UPS or FEDEX and are unable to send out packages meant to be shipped through these companies. Services we provide include:
data.text:
The address you are mailing to should be in the center of the envelope and written as follows:

Recipient's name

Street address (with apartment or suite number)

City, State and ZIP code (on the same line) *

The return address should be written in the upper left-hand corner of the envelope as follows:

Senderâ€™s name

Street address (with apartment or suite number)

City, State and ZIP code (on the same line) *

The stamp or postage is placed in the upper right-hand corner of the envelope.

First-Class Mail International is the most affordable way to send letters and lightweight packages to more than 190 countries. Faster delivery options are available, and prices will vary. Customs forms will need to be filled out either on paper or online.

Media Mail is a cost-effective way to send media and educational materials such as books, CDs, DVDs, and other printed and bound matter. This service has restrictions on the type of media that can be sent. Prices start at $4.13.

A passport photo must be taken in clothing that is normally worn on a daily basis.

Glasses, hats, and head coverings cannot be worn for the photo.

If you cannot remove your glasses for medical reasons, please include a signed note from your doctor with your application.

If you wear a hat or head covering for religious purposes, submit a signed statement that verifies that the hat or head covering in your photo is part of recognized, traditional religious attire that is customarily or required to be worn continuously in public.

If you wear a hat or head covering for medical purposes, submit a signed doctor's statement verifying the hat or head covering in your photo is used daily for medical purposes.

If you are wearing a head covering for religious or medical purposes, your full face must be visible and the hat or head covering cannot obscure your hairline or cast shadows on your face.

Campus Connection is not an acceptance facility for passport applications. We do not issue passports or other travel documents.

For information about applying for your passport please see How to Apply for a Passport.
